Class Auction

  • java.lang.Object
    • Auction

  • public class Auction
extends java.lang.Object
    A simple model of an auction. The auction maintains a list of lots of arbitrary length.
    Version:
    2006.03.30, 2.0, <04/10/17>
    Author:
    David J. Barnes and Michael Kolling., (of AuctionSkeleton) Lynn Marshall,

    • Constructor Detail

      • Auction

        public Auction()
        Create a new auction.

      • Auction

        public Auction(Auction passedAuction)
        This constructor takes an Auction as a parameter. Provided the auction parameter is closed, the constructor creates a new auction containing the unsold lots of the closed auction. If the auction parameter is still open or null, this constructor behaves like the default constructor. (You need to write the entire method.)
        Parameters:
        passedAuction - takes in an auction with its unsold items

    • Method Detail

      • bidFor

        public boolean bidFor(int lotNumber,
                      Person bidder,
                      long value)
        Bid for a lot. Prints a message indicating whether the bid is successful or not. First print a blank line. Then print whether or not the bid is successful. If the bid is successful, also print the lot number, high bidder's name, and the bid value. If the bid is not successful, also print the lot number and high bid (but not the high bidder's name). Returns false if the auction is closed, the lot doesn't exist, the bidder is null, or the bid was not positive and true otherwise
        Parameters:
        number - The lot number being bid for.
        bidder - The person bidding for the lot.
        value - The value of the bid.
        Returns:
        boolean will return true if the bid for the lot is the highest bid, will return true if the bid is not as high as the highest bid

      • close

        public boolean close()
        Closes the auction and prints information on the lots. First print a blank line. Then for each lot, its number and description are printed. If it did sell, the high bidder and bid value are also printed. If it didn't sell, that information is printed.
        Returns:
        boolean true if the auction is sucessfully closed

      • enterLot

        public boolean enterLot(java.lang.String description)
        Enter a new lot into the auction. Returns false if the auction is not open or if the description is null.
        Parameters:
        description - A description of the lot.
        Returns:
        true if the lot has been added

      • getLot

        public Lot getLot(int lotNumber)
        Return the lot with the given number. Do not assume that the lots are stored in numerical order. Returns null if the lot does not exist. (You need to update the code.)
        Parameters:
        lotNumber - The number of the lot to return.
        Returns:
        the Lot with the given number

      • getNoBids

        public java.util.ArrayList<Lot> getNoBids()
        Returns an ArrayList containing all the items that have no bids so far. (or have not sold if the auction has ended).
        Parameters:
        an - ArrayList of lots
        Returns:
        an ArrayList of the Lots which currently have no bids

      • removeLot

        public boolean removeLot(int number)
        Remove the lot with the given lot number, as long as the lot has no bids, and the auction is open. You must use an Iterator object to search the list and, if applicable, remove the item. Do not assume that the lots are stored in numerical order. Returns true if successful, false otherwise (auction closed, lot does not exist, or lot has a bid).
        Parameters:
        number - The number of the lot to be removed.
        Returns:
        true if the lot was sucessfully removed

      • showLots

        public void showLots()
        Show the full list of lots in this auction. Print a blank line first, to make our output look nicer. If there are no lots, print a message indicating this
